name: Seated Triceps Press
how_to_perform:
# Seated Triceps Press

1. Sit at a bench or chair with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing backward (towards your heels).
3. Take a deep breath and engage your core to maintain proper posture.

4. Slowly lower the dumbbells behind your head, keeping your elbows close to your body until you've reached the desired depth of movement.
5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.

6. Press the dumbbells back up to the starting position by straightening your arms fully, squeezing your triceps muscles as they extend.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core engaged and your body stable throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The Seated Triceps Press is a seated upper body exercise that primarily works the triceps muscle.
